values.value: The Minimum Necessary Rule requires covered entities to make reasonable efforts to limit PHI access to the minimum necessary to accomplish the intended purpose. Granting broad permissions like "Modify All Data" or "View All Data" to users who do not require complete access to PHI violates this principle.

1. Review the permission set assignment and identify which specific objects/fields the user actually needs access to. 2. Create a granular permission set with only the required object and field-level permissions. 3. Remove the overly permissive permission (Modify All Data/View All Data). 4. Document the business justification for any elevated access. 5. Schedule quarterly access reviews for users with PHI access.
